analysis.raw_content:
Extracted content from the provided page image (verbatim where legible; unclear items marked [unclear]):

Left sidebar
- Header: Daylight plane
- Text: The daylight plane in conjunction with the setbacks & height limits, create an invisible tent intended to contain development on the lot in a way that preserves privacy and exposure to natural light.
- Code sections
  - Page 26
    - 18.12.040 (a) Table 2
  - Page 27
    - 18.04
  - Page 28
    - 18.12.040 (a) Table 2
  - Page 29
    - 18.12.050 (b) (2)
    - 18.12.040 (i)

Main header
- Primary daylight plane (sides)

Gray box statement
- The primary daylight plane regulates structures located within the buildable area. Structures located in the rear and/or side yards are regulated by the accessory-structure daylight plan described on the next page.

Figure caption
- Fig 20 Front elevation showing side primary daylight plane

Diagram labels and callouts
- 45°
- 10' from average grade
- Side lot line (appears at both side boundaries)
- Max. allowed is [regulated] by Building Code [word “regulated” inferred by visibility; the rest “by Building Code” legible; if “regulated” is not exact, this callout is [unclear]]
- Average grade
- Grade at the nearest point on the adjacent lot
- Existing grade of the structure (at midpoint of wall)
- 24' max. for portions [unclear remainder of this note]
- Max. building height (with star symbol)

Notes (bullet list beneath figure)
- Daylight plane is measured from average grade.
- Average grade is established using existing grade—before any grading or fill (See Fig 44 p. 42)
- Side daylight plane is measured (up) at lot line.
- Rear daylight plane is measured (up) at rear setback.

Footer
- 26

Items requiring a clearer image to confirm precisely
- The complete text of the callout beginning “Max. allowed is … by Building Code” (the middle word(s) are fuzzy).
- The complete text following “24' max. for portions …” on the right side of the diagram.
